org.jpws.pwslib.data

Class PwsRecord

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsRecord
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class PwsRecord
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    This class is a container for data fields belonging to a Password Safe database entry. The set refers to a canon of field definitions given by the Password Safe persistent file description. The file format version this class implements is 3.0D, or 3.13. The following fields of the description are NOT available in the interface (although they are preserved when loaded from other applications): Double-Click-Action, Shift-Double-Click-Action, Run-Command. These are specialised fields which tend to be platform specific and we don't have use for them here.

    A record-ID - a UUID object - holds an immutable universal value and is by design always existent on a PwsRecord. A minimum set of fields must be assigned non-empty for a record in order to qualify for property "VALID" (e.g. could be made required for a record list). These fields are: TITLE and PASSWORD.

    Instances of this class can be added to and updated at PwsRecordList or PwsFile objects. Any iterator over type PwsRecord can be used to create a persistent Password Safe file, e.g. on external media, by calling the save methods of PwsFileFactory.

    Non-Canonical Fields

    Field types outside of the canon are supported in various ways.
    A) Non-canonical fields coming from other applications via persistent state are tolerated and stored back to file when a record is saved.
    B) An application may utilise Extra Fields (one field value per type) by use of methods setExtraField() and getExtraField(). These fields also become part of the persistent state in a well-defined way and should be conserved in other applications unless they share conflicting type values. It is recommended private applications do not claim field type numbers below 128.

    Transient Properties

    The record property "IMPORT-STATUS" can be set by the user or is automatically set through PwsRecordList.merge(). It is purely informative about which records have been merged and not reflected into the persistent state.

    Conventions:

    Normalised Group Names. Group names, as values of the record field GROUP, may contain any sequence of valid elementary group names separated by a "." character. No "." character is permitted at the beginning or end of the value. No empty elementary name is permitted (".."). The "." character always has the meaning of separating group hierarchy levels and can not be a part of elementary group names.

    See Also:
    PwsFileFactory

        Returns:

      • passwordUpdated

        public void passwordUpdated()
        This sets PASSMODTIME and ACCESSTIME to the current system time and should be called after a password value was modified.

        For reasons of flexibility this is not automatically called when modifying a password through setPassword(). Time values can be set independent from existence of the PASSWORD value.

      • addUnknownField

        protected void addUnknownField(int type,
                               byte[] value)
        Adds an unknown field value to this record for the purpose of conservation. In contrast to setExtraField() no validation is performed on the type value. Does nothing if value is null.

        Note that this value is stored internally in cleartext during program session.

        Parameters:
        type - int, field type number (0..255)
        value - byte array, field value (exact length)

      • setExtraField

        public void setExtraField(int type,
                          byte[] value,
                          int format)
        Puts a data field into this record which forms a non-canonical field identified by its integer type code. Only non-canonical field types may be entered; use the null value to clear the field from the list of unknown fields. Notes: This value is stored internally in cleartext during program session. This method replaces a previous occurrence of same type in the unknown field list. Whether a field value is canonical can be tested by PwsFileFactory.isCanonicalField().
        Parameters:
        type - int, non-canonical field type number within 0..255
        value - field value, or null to remove the field
        format - the referenced file format version or 0 for default

      • getUnknownFields

        public java.util.Iterator<PwsRawField> getUnknownFields()
        Returns an iterator over all unknown fields stored for this record.
        Returns:
        Iterator of element type PwsRawField

      • getUnknownFieldCount

        public int getUnknownFieldCount()
        Returns the number of data fields which are not canonical in this record. (This includes fields added by setExtraField() method.)
        Returns:
        int size of unknown field list

      • getBlockedDataSize

        public long getBlockedDataSize(int format,
                               java.lang.String charset)
        Returns the size of the data block required to store the content of this record on a persistent state. (This takes into account the general file formating rules of a PWS file.)
        Parameters:
        format - int, the file format version of the persistent state
        charset - String, name of charset used to encode text
        Returns:
        int required (blocked) data space
        Throws:
        java.nio.charset.IllegalCharsetNameException - if charset is unknown to the executing VM

      • getUnknownFieldSize

        public long getUnknownFieldSize(int format)
        Returns the total data size of all unknown fields in this record. (This refers to blocked data size according to the specified file format.)
        Parameters:
        format - int, the format version of the persistent state to be considered
        Returns:
        long, data size of "unknown" fields

      • clearExtraFields

        public void clearExtraFields()
        Permanently removes all unknown (or "extra") fields from this record.

      • getExtraField

        public byte[] getExtraField(int type)
        Returns a copy of a field value from the "unknown" field list of this record that matches the given field type code.
        Parameters:
        type - int, field type number (0..255)
        Returns:
        byte[], cleartext field value or null if field is not available

      • normalisedStringParam

        protected static java.lang.String normalisedStringParam(java.lang.String param)
        Returns a normalised version of the parameter String value. For a value not null: trims the value, and if the result equals the empty string, the value is transformed into a null value.
        Returns:
        String normalised value or null

      • setInitialize

        public void setInitialize(boolean b)
        Opportunity to set an initializing phase for a record. If true, any field setup will not cause the record modify time (MODIFYTIME) to get updated.
        Parameters:
        b - boolean, true == init phase active

      • getRecordID

        public UUID getRecordID()
        Returns the RECORD-ID field of this record as a UUID object.
        Returns:
        UUID

      • setRecordID

        public void setRecordID(UUID uuid)
        Sets the RECORD-ID field of this record from the parameter UUID value. Should be used with great care! (This does not update any time fields.)
        Parameters:
        uuid - UUID, the new Record-ID value
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if parameter is null

      • getImportStatus

        public int getImportStatus()
        Returns the import status. If this record was imported by the PwsRecordList.merge() method, it will carry one of the status flags IMPORTED or IMPORTED_CONFLICT.
        Returns:
        int, record's import status (0 for no flag)

      • setImportStatus

        public void setImportStatus(int v)
        Sets the import status of this record.
        Parameters:
        v - int, the import status flag to be set

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Whether this record equals the parameter object.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        obj - Object, compare object, may be null
        Returns:
        true if and only if the parameter compare object is a PwsRecord with RECORD-ID same as this record's ID

        A hashcode value coherent with the equals function.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        int

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        A String representation of this record. Renders the Record-ID.
        Example/format: "{01234567-89ab-cdef-0123-456789abcdef}"
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String

      • getCRC

        public int getCRC()
        Returns a CRC checksum value for the contents of this record. The sum includes the record-ID value.

        It may not be assumed that this value is identical over different releases of this software package. It may be assumed that it is identical over different program sessions with the same software package.

        Returns:
        int, CRC32 value incorporating all variable record elements

      • getSignature

        public byte[] getSignature()
        Renders a unique signature value of this record and its actual data state. Returns a SHA-256 checksum over all data content of this record, including its UUID value. (Each record is guaranteed an individual value, regardless of its data content.)

        There is no guarantee that this value is identical over different releases of this software, however, it may be assumed that it is identical over different program sessions running the same package.

        Returns:
        byte[] 32 byte signature value (SHA-256 digest)

      • getPassPolicyName

        public java.lang.String getPassPolicyName()
        If the password policy for this record is defined by a policy name (rather than an individual policy) then the name is returned here, null otherwise.
        Returns:
        String Policy Name or null if undefined

      • setPassPolicyName

        public void setPassPolicyName(java.lang.String policyName)
        Sets a Password Policy Name for this record. This attempts to define the password policy via a template name, ranking over a directly supplied policy. (The template is to be defined in a file header value! The name here, however, can be supplied without control.)
        Parameters:
        policyName - String policy name or null to clear
